Steps:
1. Navigate to /auth/admin
2. Enter admin password
3. Click Sign In
Expected Result: Login succeeds; redirected to /admin dashboard

Steps:
1. Navigate to /auth/admin
2. Enter wrong password
3. Click Sign In
Expected Result: Error: "Invalid admin password."

Steps:
1. Navigate to /auth/admin
2. Leave password blank
3. Click Sign In
Expected Result: Error: "Please enter a password."

Steps:
1. Navigate to /auth/admin
2. Click "Sign in with Google"
3. Authenticate with @mojitax.com account
Expected Result: Login succeeds; redirected to /admin

Steps:
1. Navigate to /auth/admin
2. Click "Sign in with Google"
3. Authenticate with non-@mojitax.com account
Expected Result: Error: "Access denied. Only @mojitax.com accounts are allowed."

Steps: 1. Navigate to /auth/admin
Expected Result: Automatically redirected to /admin

Steps: 1. Click logout button
Expected Result: Session cookie cleared; redirected to /auth/admin

Steps: 1. Navigate to /admin
Expected Result: Dashboard loads with 4 stat cards: Total Users, Active Channels, Messages Today, Emails Sent This Week

Steps: 1. View stat cards on overview page
Expected Result: Each card shows real counts from the database

Steps: 1. Click each sidebar section: Overview, Users, Email Logs, Moji Settings, Chat Analytics, User Moderation, Group Moderation, Platform Settings, Event Invitees
Expected Result: Each section loads its respective content

Test Case: Quick Action - Go to Chat Mode
Steps: 1. Click "Go to Chat Mode" button on overview page
Expected Result: Switches to full ChatLayout in admin mode; admin badge visible

Steps: 1. Use the toggle switch in the header to switch between Dashboard and Chat modes
Expected Result: View toggles between admin dashboard and chat interface

Test Case: Unread badge on Chat Mode button
Pre-conditions: Logged in as admin; unread messages exist
Steps: 1. View "Go to Chat Mode" button
Expected Result: Red badge shows total unread message count

Steps: 1. Click "Users" in sidebar
Expected Result: Paginated user list loads with search bar and filters

Steps: 1. Type a user's display name in search box
Expected Result: User list filters to matching results

Steps: 1. Type a user's email in search box
Expected Result: User list filters to matching results

Steps:
1. Use role filter dropdown
2. Select 'admin' or 'user'
Expected Result: List shows only users with selected role

Steps: 1. Change sort option (by created_at, last_signed_in, name)
Expected Result: User list reorders accordingly

Steps: 1. Click on a user row
Expected Result: Detailed profile view showing channels joined

Pre-conditions: Logged in as admin; target user is not admin
Steps:
1. Click on user
2. Click "Suspend"
3. Enter reason
4. Optionally set until-date
5. Confirm
Expected Result: User marked as suspended; user can no longer send messages, create tickets, or log in

Pre-conditions: Logged in as admin; target user is suspended
Steps:
1. Click on suspended user
2. Click "Unsuspend"
3. Confirm
Expected Result: User restored to normal status; can use platform again

Steps:
1. Click on a regular user
2. Click "Promote to Admin"
3. Confirm
Expected Result: User role changed to admin; can access /admin

Pre-conditions: Logged in as admin; target is another admin
Steps:
1. Click on admin user
2. Click "Demote to User"
3. Confirm
Expected Result: User role changed back to user; loses admin access

Steps:
1. Click on another admin user
2. Attempt to suspend
Expected Result: Error: "Cannot suspend admin users"

Pre-conditions: Logged in as admin; more than one page of users
Steps:
1. Click "Next" page button
2. Click "Previous" page button
Expected Result: Page changes; different users shown on each page

Steps: 1. Click "User Moderation" in sidebar
Expected Result: User list loads in moderation mode with suspend/unsuspend actions

Steps:
1. Find user
2. Click suspend
3. Enter reason
4. Confirm
Expected Result: User suspended; reflected in user list

Pre-conditions: Logged in as admin; user is suspended
Steps:
1. Find suspended user
2. Click unsuspend
3. Confirm
Expected Result: User unsuspended

Steps: 1. Click "Group Moderation" in sidebar

3. Enter reason
4. Confirm

2. Click "Unsuspend"

Steps:

4. Click Publish
